meanings.definition: To be a source of danger or harm
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds threatening rain made everyone hurry indoors.
meanings.sent2: The bully was threatening to hurt the smaller kids if they didn't give him their lunch money.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was threatening to steal all the nuts from the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The loud thunder threatening to shake the ground with its power.
meanings.sent5: The growling dog was threatening to protect its territory at all costs.

meanings.definition: Expressing an intention to cause harm or damage
meanings.sent1: The man's threatening tone made everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent2: The threatening letter from the stalker was handed over to the police.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a threatening look to the mouse, but then purred and walked away.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds had a threatening presence as they loomed over the town.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's threatening glare silenced the noisy students instantly.

meanings.sent1: The loud thunder was threatening to the scared child.
meanings.sent2: The dark alley had a threatening aura that made people avoid it.
meanings.sent3: The clown's threatening makeup actually made the children laugh.
meanings.sent4: The shadowy figure in the corner seemed threatening in the dim light.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the abandoned house was threatening to the explorers.
